Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my enthusiasm for the Software Engineer (Starshield) position at SpaceX. SpaceX’s mission to expand humanity’s presence beyond Earth, combined with Starshield’s focus on secure, resilient space-based capabilities for national security, is deeply compelling to me. I am excited by the opportunity to apply my software engineering expertise to systems that operate at planetary scale and have real-world impact.

I am currently a Principal Software Engineer at Coached.com, where I design and deliver highly reliable, distributed software systems end to end—from requirements and architecture to deployment and operational support. I have led the development of microservices platforms that significantly improved delivery speed and system reliability, and I have introduced DevOps and CI/CD practices that enabled faster, safer iteration. This full-lifecycle ownership strongly aligns with Starshield’s expectation that engineers see their software through from concept to on-orbit operations and beyond.

My technical background includes strong proficiency in C++, Python, and Java, with extensive experience building performance-critical services, debugging complex distributed systems, and optimizing software under demanding constraints. I have worked extensively in Linux-based environments and cloud infrastructure, leveraging Docker, Kubernetes, and automated testing frameworks to ensure reliability and repeatability. While my career has focused on terrestrial systems, I am particularly motivated by Starshield’s emphasis on applying strong software fundamentals—networking, performance optimization, simulation, and testing—to the unique challenges of in-space mesh networks and satellite constellations.

Across roles at Coached.com, Resume Worded, and Microsoft, I have collaborated closely with interdisciplinary teams, translated ambiguous problem statements into robust technical solutions, and delivered software that performs reliably in real-world production environments. I thrive in fast-paced settings with evolving requirements, enjoy tackling hard systems problems, and consistently take initiative to improve both code quality and engineering processes.

I am highly motivated to contribute to Starshield’s mission of guaranteeing secure and reliable access to space. I would welcome the opportunity to bring my experience in large-scale systems, networking-aware software design, and continuous delivery to SpaceX, and I am willing to meet the clearance and work-availability requirements associated with this role.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to the possibility of discussing how my skills and mindset can contribute to the Starshield software team.

Sincerely,
Lani Sanberg

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the Software Engineer, Infrastructure role at Meta. I am a final-year Computer Science student at City, University of London, specializing in Artificial Intelligence, with hands-on experience building scalable software systems and ML-powered applications. I am excited by Meta’s mission to connect billions of people and by the opportunity to contribute to large-scale infrastructure that powers impactful products.

Through my internship as a Machine Learning Engineer at TechStart AI, I collaborated closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy production-ready systems. I built and optimized text classification models using PyTorch, developed robust data preprocessing pipelines in Python, and deployed services using FastAPI and Docker on AWS. By profiling and optimizing inference workflows, I achieved a 25% reduction in latency, reinforcing my focus on performance, efficiency, and system reliability—key aspects of infrastructure engineering.

Beyond internships, my academic and project experience has strengthened my ability to own features end-to-end. For my final-year project, I designed and implemented an AI-powered resume parser and job matcher, taking responsibility for system architecture, API design, and integration between backend services and frontend components. This project required thoughtful trade-offs around scalability, maintainability, and extensibility, and it achieved 85% matching accuracy in real-world evaluations. I regularly applied best practices such as modular design, code reviews, and testing to ensure long-term code quality.

I am comfortable working across a variety of languages and technologies, including Python, Java, JavaScript, cloud platforms, and containerized environments, and I enjoy learning new systems and architectural patterns. I take pride in writing maintainable, testable code and in communicating technical ideas clearly to teammates, helping drive alignment and shared ownership of complex systems.

Meta’s emphasis on building efficient, scalable infrastructure and empowering engineers to take ownership strongly resonates with me. I would welcome the opportunity to bring my software engineering skills, systems mindset, and passion for impact to Meta’s Infrastructure team.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to the opportunity to further discuss my candidacy.

Sincerely,
Edie Advocate
